item.title: Litter and debris along pavements, 23rd July
item.description:
There is always a lot of litter and debris along this wide stretch of pavement which never seems to get cleared. It runs all the way from number 50 to 56 but is worse on the wider stretch outside number 52 and 54 where litter and debris builds up in crevices and behind the junction boxes.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Yester Road, Elmstead, London
Report on FixMyStreet

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Camberwell Green, Camberwell, London

item.title: Lifebuoys vandalised, 23rd July
item.description:
Two lifebuoys on Bankside have had the rope pulled out from the cases, so that they are trailing from the floor. One towards Blackfriars Stn, and another near Southwark Bridge. Would it be possible to check that everything is in order, please?
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Southwark, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Rubbish on pavement, 23rd July
item.description:
Hi Residents from 54 green lanes flat 2 And residents of 56 B the only flat occupied by students, and residents from 50 A & B green lanes have been repeatedly throwing their bin bags on the pavement street as you can see at any time they want, it stinks

Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Green Lanes, Hackney, London

item.title: Abandoned van, 23rd July
item.description:
